summary: This bill, the "Undertaking Negotiations on Investment and Trade for Economic Dynamism Act" (UNITED Act), grants the President authority to negotiate a comprehensive trade agreement with the United Kingdom. It emphasizes the importance of open trade, aiming to improve US economic well-being, strengthen ties with allies, and potentially increase export opportunities. The bill outlines the negotiating process, authority limitations, congressional consultation, and implementing procedures, including adherence to existing trade agreements and the Bipartisan Congressional Trade Priorities and Accountability Act of 2015. It also highlights the special relationship between the US and UK and prioritizes the protection of workers and the environment.
